learning_outcomes.description: understand writing as a creative, problem-solving process
work with the elements of story and other strategies to produce engaging, persuasive, & reader-focused writing
design and produce a creative and well-written response to a project brief
understand the importance of regular writing, reading, and reflection for your development as a communication professional
analyse how written texts are constructed and evaluate their effectiveness
identify and address common writing problems in your own and others' work

assessments.task_description:
The tutorials in Weeks 3, 4, 5, 9, 10, 11, & 12 will involve a 20 minute worksheet with questions designed to test your ability to apply the concepts and techniques introduced in that week's lecture. Your best 5 results out of 7 will determine the mark out of 20.

For further details on what is required and how it will be assessed, please refer to Blackboard.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Work is hand-written and submitted for assessment to tutors during class.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: There is no requirement that students complete all 7 in-class exercises but they are welcome to request access to a missed exercise (if they have a medical certificate or equivalent to explain their absence) by contacting the course coordinator Nat (n.collie@uq.edu.au) as soon as possible after the missed tutorial.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
The writing project - a short zine - involves two stages. Stage one involves presenting a project proposal in the Week 7 tutorial. Students will be required to discuss their zine design in small groups for feedback before submitting the proposal to their tutor for assesment by end of class.

For further information on what is required and how it will be assessed, please refer to the Assessment page on Blackboard.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assignment requires submission of the original hardcopy in your scheduled Week 7 tutorial. Digital submission (emailed or uploaded) is not available.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

Submit to Blackboard a scanned copy (PDF) of the project. Please refer to the Assessment page on Blackboard for further instructions on how to do this.
assessments.task_description:
In stage two of the writing project, students incorporate feedback on their proposal and further develop the project. The final hardcopy product will be produced by hand and then scanned and submitted as a PDF for assessment.

For further information about this assessment item and how it will be assessed, please refer to the Assessment page on Blackboard. Tutorials will include opportunities to discuss and work on the project.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. 

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The end of semester exam will use a combination of multiple choice and short answer questions to assess the ability of students to apply key concepts from the course.

Please refer to the Assessment page on Blackboard for further details and example questions. We will also discuss how to prepare for the exam in tutorials.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
